intro: Hieracium valdepilosum, commonly known as the Valdese Hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from June to August. Hieracium valdepilosum is often found in meadows, pastures, and rocky slopes, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
